keyTakeAways: A Colombian appeals court has overturned the conviction of former President Alvaro Uribe for fraud and bribery, citing structural deficiencies in the original ruling.
Uribe’s conviction was historic — the first time a former Colombian president was convicted of a crime.
The decision has intensified political divisions, with critics accusing the judiciary of covering up right-wing paramilitary abuses during Colombia’s internal conflict.
Opposition leaders like President Gustavo Petro argue the ruling enables a narrative that protects paramilitary-linked political figures.
Senator Ivan Cepeda has announced plans to appeal the decision to the Supreme Court of Justice, signaling the case is far from concluded.
The ruling may influence the 2026 presidential election, with Uribe’s party and allies potentially gaining momentum.
U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio have expressed support for Uribe, criticizing what they see as judicial bias against right-wing leaders in Latin America.

Former President Uribe, a controversial figure known for military campaigns against left-wing rebels, has long maintained his innocence, and allegations of witness manipulation remain central to the case.
Uribe’s ties to paramilitary groups in the 1990s — especially the Bloque Metro — have been a major point of contention in the legal case.
The case reflects deeper tensions in Colombia between state institutions, political power, and historical accountability in the context of armed conflict and human rights abuses.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Colombian appeals court has overturned the conviction of former President Alvaro Uribe for fraud and bribery, citing structural flaws in the original ruling, including insufficient evidence. This marks the first time a former Colombian president has been convicted of a crime. The decision has sparked political controversy, with President Gustavo Petro accusing the judiciary of covering up right-wing paramilitary abuses. Uribe, who governed from 2002 to 2010 and has long maintained his innocence, faces ongoing legal challenges, including an appeal by Senator Ivan Cepeda to the Supreme Court. The case remains central to Colombia’s political discourse and may significantly influence the 2026 presidential election. The reversal has also drawn international attention, with U.S. political figures like Donald Trump and Marco Rubio expressing support for Uribe, criticizing Latin American judicial systems as biased. The decision is viewed as a pivotal moment in Colombia’s ongoing struggle to address historical ties between political power and paramilitary violence.
title: Colombian appeals court strikes down ex-President Uribe’s conviction
